verses.roman:
anye nirbhinna-bāhūru-
śiraso rudhirokṣitāḥ
rājāno dudravar bhītā
balena paṅghārditāḥ

synonyms: anye—others; nirbhinna—broken; bāhu—their arms; ūru—thighs; śirasaḥ—and heads; rudhira—with blood; ukṣitāḥ—drenched; rājānaḥ—kings; dudruvuḥ—fled; bhītāḥ—frightened; balena—by Lord Balarāma; parigha—with His club; arditāḥ—tormented.
translation: Tormented by Lord Balarāma's club, the other kings fled in fear, their arms, thighs and heads broken and their bodies drenched in blood.
